definition: -ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: Did he use to take the underground to go to work?
sentences.chinese: 他以前是否常常乘搭地下铁路上班？

sentences.english: Why not build more underground lines?
sentences.chinese: 为什么不铺设更多的地下铁路呢？

sentences.english: Switzerland wants that freight underground, on the railways, and the new tunnel should achieve just that.
sentences.chinese: 瑞士希望这些货物在地下铁路通过，因此要开凿隧道。

sentences.english: The underground railway runs 24 hours a day.
sentences.chinese: 地下铁路一天24小时都在运行。

sentences.english: New Underground Rail puzzle pieces have been added.
sentences.chinese: 增加了新的地下铁路拼接组件。
